title: This assignment tests you to how to use user defined exceptions in any java program.

questionText.text:
Use the program which is developed in List ADT (Abstract Data Types) unit and create the Generic ListADT which accepts any T like character, integer, float, etc as follows.
subList(int, int) : Returns a list containing elements, including startIndex and excluding endIndex. The first parameter indicates the startIndex and the second parameter indicates the endIndex.
equals(<T>[]) : Returns a boolean indicating whether the parameter <T>[] exactly matches with the given list or not
clear() : Removes all the elements from list
retainAll(<T>[]) : Retains only the elements in this list that are contained in the specified element array.
contains(<T>): returns true, if given element is in list.
indexOf(<T>) : Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified element in this list, or -1 if this list does not contain the <T>
removeAll() : Removes from this list all of its elements that are contained in the specified generic array.
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed
